intro: Brassaiopsis disperma, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences called cyathia. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture. Brassaiopsis disperma is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
